item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ross Ulbricht granted a full pardon (825 points | 837 comments)
2. Stargate Project: SoftBank, OpenAI, Oracle, MGX to build data centers (574 points | 615 comments)
3. 0-click deanonymization attack targeting Signal, Discord, other platforms (1141 points | 370 comments)
4. Moving on from React, a year later (150 points | 79 comments)
5. Hunyuan3D 2.0 – High-Resolution 3D Assets Generation (174 points | 73 comments)
6. Infinigen (63 points | 6 comments)
7. Isolating complexity is the essence of successful abstractions (72 points | 14 comments)
8. Ask HN: How are you preparing for PEPPOL? (37 points | 35 comments)
9. Tensor Product Attention Is All You Need (37 points | 28 comments)
10. Invisible Electrostatic Wall at 3M plant (1996) (319 points | 162 comments)
11. What are these bumps on the top of a pull-tab can? (127 points | 9 comments)
12. Calm tech certification "rewards" less distracting tech (249 points | 68 comments)
13. Why is zero plural? (2024) (42 points | 71 comments)
14. Icelandic turf houses: Laufas, Glaumbaer and others (5 points | discuss)
15. Evo: Version control that works the way you think (35 points | 23 comments)

18. Mercator: Extreme (145 points | 30 comments)
19. Open-source browser port of Pitfall from the Atari 2600 (49 points | 12 comments)
20. Ask HN: Is anyone doing anything cool with tiny language models? (345 points | 154 comments)

22. The Peppermills of Jens Quistgaard (64 points | 38 comments)
23. Dissecting "Tiny Clouds" shadertoy (2017) (34 points | discuss)
24. JReleaser: quick and effortless way to release your project (72 points | 18 comments)
25. Prime numbers so memorable that people hunt for them (127 points | 70 comments)
26. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
27. Sigstore: Making sure your software is what it claims to be (71 points | 20 comments)
28. Interview with Jeff Atwood, Co-Founder of Stack Overflow (47 points | 56 comments)
29. Rafael Araujo's 20 Mesmerizing Geometrical Masterpieces (2024) (100 points | 13 comments)
30. More than 40% of postdocs leave academia, study reveals (176 points | 197 comments)
